intro: Pasania rassa var. suffruticosa, commonly known as the dwarf pasania, is a shrub-like plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring small, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It is adapted to dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its compact size and ornamental flowers, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
